CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1953, pg. 15 reads: "Spring Finery - The faces of little Edith and Betty Lane, left to right, of the Davis Home, became studies in female joy when they tried on the dresses that Junior Red Cross girls at South Vocational High School made for them. Enjoying the proceedings is Beverly Gallaher of 348 Amabell Street, Mount Washington, who had a hand in Junior Red Cross project.  Smiles likewise lit the faces of twenty other little ladies at such institutions and hospitals as the Queen Esther Home for Children and Leech Farm, when they received dresses like these. - Harris Photo.
TitMainTitle: Unknown woman, Edith Lane, Betty Lane, and Beverly Gallaher wearing Red Cross arm band, gathered in the Davis Home
